OOC: That was AWESOME! I thought I'd never say that. But it was true, that =
was REALLY awesome. Is the guy with the guitar named Super Guitar Man? Beca=
use that's what I'd name him........GORE!...
  ----- Original Message -----=
 
  From: KSLawdogg@... 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monday, J=
uly 16, 2001 10:45 PM
  Subject: Postponed Rock of Ages


  Unknown Robots:=







  Deep within the depths of Cybertron in Predacon controlled territo=
ry a small 
  Predacon was running as fast as he could, ducking between cor=
ners and alleys, 
  looking over his shoulder every few seconds spotting no=
thing, but he could 
  hear it.  The distant sound of someone or something =
playing hard on an 
  electric guitar or two.

  The Predacon turned anothe=
r corner, a dead end.  He looked around, the once 
  faint sound getting lo=
uder and louder.  Full of fear, he began pounding on 
  the wall that block=
ed his path.  A stronger robot might've been able to smash 
  his way throu=
gh and continue on.  Or a robot with a jetpack or boosters 
  would've been=
 able to fly to safety.  But this Predacon had none of those.

  He reached=
 into subspace, taking out his laser rifle and turning around, 
  activatin=
g his comm. unit.  "This is Alabastor!  All Defcons get over here!  
  They=
're after me!  Hurry the slag up!" he screamed into his shoulder comm. 
  u=
nit to his other gang members but got no reply.  He raised his pistol as he=
 
  saw something move and fired off a single bolt, the superheated laser d=
igging 
  into the wall and leaving a small burned dent.

  He focused, on =
realized it was nothing.  Just his imagination, but he was 
  still frantic=
.  "I'm dead...I'm dead..." he said looking around, formulating 
  a quick =
scheme.  He put away his rifle and took out his energon knife, 
  climbing =
up on a couple stacked boxes and leaping, stabbing his blade into 
  the wa=
ll.  It worked, as he was hanging on by the blade a few feet off the 
  gro=
und.  

  He reached his free arm up as far as it would go, pulling himself=
 slowly when 
  suddenly a sound that reminded him of laser rang out and a =
burning sensation 
  suddenly started in his back.  Alabastor lost his grip=
 and fell in pain, 
  slamming to the ground.

  He shook his head, slowly =
getting to his feet, as painful as it was with the 
  wound in his back, th=
e electric guitar riffs over.  He looked around, 
  spotting three robots. =
 

  "You bastards..."

  "Shut up, Alabastor.  We wouldn't suggest trying =
to call your friends.  
  They're all dead."

  "Wh--"

  "No, shut up.  I =
wasn't finished quite yet.  You see," the robot said, 
  beginning a small =
little tune on his electric guitar, which obviously wasn't 
  plugged into =
anything so Alabastor was a little confused how he was playing 
  it, but t=
hat was his least cocnern.

  "You see," the robot continued, "you tried to=
 muscle in on our turf.  But you 
  didn't count on us, so we whiped you ou=
t."

  "Most definately.  It was cake, man." one of the other robots said.
=

  "Hey, shut up, man." the original robot said.  "Anyway, long story short=
, we 
  don't like it, you betrayed us, and now you can die."

  "But I did=
n't do it!  It was one of my Lieutenants!"

  "Yeah, well," the robot said,=
 starting with a complete riff on his guitar, 
  turning a few dials, "we d=
on't really care." he snickered, playing a quick 
  hard riff, sonic waves =
tearing through the air towards Alabastor, Alabastor 
  screaming in pain a=
s he scratched at his insides, suddenly blowing up.

  "That dude was lame.=
"

  "Most definately."

p://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
